intro: Helipterum floribundum, commonly known as the showy helipterum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in well-drained environments. It produces bright yellow to orange flowers that bloom in spring and summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Helipterum floribundum is often found in coastal and inland regions, showcasing its adaptability to diverse ecological conditions.
